SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.abi

Interface DynamicAbiType

All Superinterfaces:
AbiType
All Known Implementing Classes:
Array, Bytes, Tuple, Utf8String
public sealed interface DynamicAbiType extends AbiType permits Bytes, Utf8String, Array<T>, Tuple
Represents variable-size ABI types that require offset-based indirection in encoding.

Dynamic types have variable-length encoding where the head contains an offset pointer to the actual data in the tail section. This is in contrast to static types which always occupy exactly 32 bytes and are encoded directly in place.

Variable-size types include:

  • Bytes - dynamic bytes (note: bytesN types are static)
  • Utf8String - UTF-8 encoded strings
  • Array - arrays (T[] is always dynamic, T[N] is dynamic if T is dynamic)
  • Tuple - tuples containing any dynamic component

Note that some permitted types may be static in certain configurations (e.g., bytesN, static arrays with static elements, tuples with all static components). The default implementation returns true, but implementations may override this based on their actual content.

Since:
0.1.0-alpha

    • isDynamic

      default boolean isDynamic()
      Returns whether this type is dynamic.

      Dynamic types require offset-based encoding in ABI. By default, types implementing this interface are considered dynamic, but specific implementations may override this based on their configuration (e.g., bytesN is static, static arrays of static elements are static).

      Specified by:
      isDynamic in interface AbiType
      Returns:
